H0.text: Both parents are the source from which a male puppy inherits traits.

H1.text: Its mother, only, is the source from which a male puppy inherits traits.

H2.text: Its father, only, is the source from which a male puppy inherits traits.

A3.text: Inheritance through the maternal line (in case of mitochondrial DNA loci)

A4.text: Inheritance through the paternal line (in case of Y-chromosomal loci)

A5.text: In humans and many other animals, the Y chromosome contains the gene that triggers the development of the specifically male characteristics.

A6.text: Nettie Stevens discovered that females only had the X chromosome and males had both X and Y chromosomes, concluding that sex is a chromosomal factor determined by the male.
